textos_fuente.text: Staff & Board of Directors - Diamond Head Theatre Skip to content Box Office: (808) 733-0274 | Business Office: (808) 733-0277 Facebook Instagram YouTube LinkedIn Email Search for: Shows & Tickets Buy Tickets Season Subscriptions Seat Map Show Archive Subscriber Login Donate Annual Giving Capital Campaign Producer‚Äôs Club Sponsorship ‚ÄòIlima Awards Auditions Show Auditions Shooting Stars Classes Year-Round Classes Summer Musical Theatre Experience Shooting Stars Instructors Scholarships About Staff & Board of Directors Instructors Volunteer Rentals News Show Archive Your New Theatre Theatrical Arts Building Make a Gift Sponsor a Seat Photos News Capital Campaign Donors Contact BUY TICKETS Staff & Board of Directors Jacque Vaughn 2025-07-23T06:29:51-10:00 STAFF & BOARD OF DIRECTORS We bring the magic of theatre to all Trevor Tamashiro, Executive Director Trevor joined Diamond Head Theatre as Executive Director in April 2023. Born and raised in Hawaii, and a graduate of Punahou School, he brings nearly 20 years of experience in nonprofit executive leadership. Trevor started his journey in New York City working for Broadway Dance Center. Other positions include: Chief Advancement Officer of The Diller-Quaile School of Music; Deputy Director of Saratoga International Theater Institute; and Deputy/Program Director for The Drama League of New York. Trevor is a member of the Association of Fundraising Professionals and is a Certified Fund Raising Executive (CFRE). He holds a degree in Theatre Arts from University of Miami, a Master of Business Administration degree from Pace University, and a Master of Science degree in Nonprofit Management from Columbia University. John Rampage, Artistic Director John Rampage is a performer, actor, choreographer, and director who has served as Diamond Head Theatre‚Äôs Artistic Director since 1995. He is the creative mastermind behind all of the theatre‚Äôs productions and programs, overseeing the curation of two or more shows each season and selects directors, musical directors, and set designers. His relationship with the theatre began in 1975 where he performed as Tommy Gilas in the 1975 production of Music Man. In the 1980s, Rampage danced and sang his way across the U.S. and Europe and returned in 1991 as choreographer of Evita. More than 120 productions have been shared with the community under his oversight. A 47-time Po‚Äòokela Award winner for excellence in the theatre, John is also the recipient of the Hawaii State Theatre Council 2006 Pierre Bowman Award. City of Miami Beach | LinkedIn Skip to main content LinkedIn Top Content People Learning Jobs Games Sign in Join now City of Miami Beach Government Administration Miami Beach, Florida 11,170 followers One Team, One City See jobs Follow View all 1,149 employees Report this company About us The City of Miami Beach was incorporated on March 26, 1915. Miami Beach operates on a commission/city manager form of government. The commission consists of a mayor and six commissioners who serve as the policy-making body of the city. The city manager ensures that policies, directives, resolutions and ordinances adopted by the city commission are enforced and implemented. The city manager is also charged with the daily operations of the city. 

Through fiscal prudence and good leadership, the city‚Äôs journey to excellence is guided by its mission, vision and strategic plan that is making Miami Beach a better place to live, work and play.

With Biscayne Bay to the west and the Atlantic Ocean to the east, the City of Miami Beach is not just a favorite for international and domestic visitors but for a growing residential population too.  The cosmopolitan island city, just 7.1 square miles, is everything that is cool and hot. Read it now: https://conta.cc/3UYSBD8 2 Like Comment Share City of Miami Beach 11,170 followers 1w Report this post Congratulations to our Information Technology Department for being recognized with a 2025 Best of Florida Award by Government Technology for Innovative Use of Data Analytics.
¬†
This recognition highlights the city‚Äôs work on data analytics initiatives and focuses on the Fleet Efficiency Analytics initiative, a collaborative effort between the Information Technology Department and Facilities & Fleet Management. The project leverages Miami Beach‚Äôs enterprise technical architecture and real-time telematics data to evaluate vehicle utilization, identify underused assets and support cost saving data-driven decisions regarding the rightsizing of the city's fleet. By visualizing complex data and performance trends, the solution enhances transparency, reduces operational costs and improves service delivery.
¬†
This award affirms the city's commitment to innovation, sustainability and continuous improvement in public service delivery. Keep up the great work, team! #InformationTechnology 167 9 Comments Like Comment Share City of Miami Beach 11,170 followers 2w Report this post The DBPR Ombudsman will be at City Hall on Thursday, September 4 from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.

This your opportunity to discuss condominium-related concerns directly with a DBPR representative.

Appointments are required, walk-ins will not be accommodated. To arrange your session or for further details, please contact Bianca Guevara at BiancaGuevara@miamibeachfl.gov . 3 Like Comment Share City of Miami Beach 11,170 followers 3w Report this post Join the Black Professionals Network in partnership with the City of Miami Beach for a live pitch night and networking mixer spotlighting Black entrepreneurs building bold businesses in our community.

Register to attend: https://lnkd.in/eybE_wFm #MBBiz #BlackBusinessMonth 3 Like Comment Share City of Miami Beach 11,170 followers 3w Report this post The Miami Beach Hispanic Affairs Committee has extended the nomination period for the 2025 Hispanic Heritage Month Awards until 5 p.m. on Thursday, August 21. The committee will honor recipients at an awards ceremony this fall.
 
National Hispanic Heritage Month is celebrated annually from September 15 to October 15. The Hispanic Heritage Month Awards are intended to honor members of the Hispanic community who live or work in the City of Miami Beach and who have made a positive contribution to the community in their respective professions.
 
The committee will select individuals or businesses from the following categories:
 
Individual ‚Äî Educator, public safety personnel, social service provider, artist, youth (under 18 involved in community service), adult contributing to the success of youth and any Hispanic Miami Beach community member.
 
Business ‚Äî Business, business owner, or employee of a qualified business (must have at least 51% Hispanic ownership).
 
Nomination forms are available here: https://lnkd.in/dBcBYbUD Completed forms can be submitted via email to leonorhernandez@miamibeachfl.gov or via mail to Leonor Hernandez, City of Miami Beach, Hispanic Affairs Committee Liaison, 1700 Convention Center Drive, Miami Beach, FL, 33139. Like Comment Share City of Miami Beach 11,170 followers 3w Report this post Join Commissioner Alex Fernandez on Wednesday, August 20 from 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. at the Miami Beach City Commission Chambers for an informative session on the property tax appeal process, presented by Miami-Dade Clerk of the Court & Comptroller Juan Fernandez-Barquin and Value Adjustment Board Chairman Senator Rene Garcia.

The session will explain how to appeal your property tax assessment and introduce the online property fraud alert system.

A Q&A will follow. Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to learn your rights as a property owner and discover the resources available to you. National Hispanic Heritage Month is celebrated annually from September 15 to October 15. The Hispanic Heritage Month Awards are intended to honor members of the Hispanic community who live or work in the City of Miami Beach and who have made a positive contribution to the community in their respective professions.
 
The committee will select individuals or businesses from the following categories:

Business ‚Äî Business, business owner, or employee of a qualified business (must have at least 51% Hispanic ownership).
 
Nomination forms are available here: https://lnkd.in/dBcBYbUD Completed forms can be submitted via email to leonorhernandez@miamibeachfl.gov or via mail to Leonor Hernandez, City of Miami Beach, Hispanic Affairs Committee Liaison, 1700 Convention Center Drive, Miami Beach, FL, 33139. 2 Like Comment Share City of Miami Beach 11,170 followers 3w Report this post Join us for a Business Concierge & Licensing Open House!

Meet directly with city staff, county agencies and local business resource partners who are here to help you cut through red tape, unlock new opportunities and get answers on the spot.

Shaking Up the Industry: On The Rocks‚Äô Journey from Garage to Global B
‚Äì Boozy Cardz Skip to content Just added to your cart Qty: View cart ( ) Continue shopping Submit Close search FREE shipping when you buy 3 or more | 20% OFF 10 or more Home Shop How To Use FAQ Contact Search Log in Cart 0 items Home Shop How To Use FAQ Contact Shaking Up the Industry: On The Rocks‚Äô Journey from Garage to Global Brand by Boozy Cardz December 1, 2023 The Humble Beginnings of a Cocktail Revolution In 2015, a visionary duo, Patrick Halbert, an entrepreneur and restaurateur, and Rocco Milano, a bartender, embarked on a journey that would revolutionize the ready-to-drink (RTD) cocktail industry. They began in a garage, experimenting with spirits and dreaming big. Their goal was simple yet ambitious: to create premium-quality cocktails with all-natural ingredients that could be enjoyed anywhere. This was the genesis of On The Rocks Cocktails (OTR). Crafting the Perfect Mix: Innovation and Partnership The founders of OTR brought a blend of industry expertise and innovative thinking to the table. They tapped into unexplored territories like air travel and hotel room service, bringing their craft-made bottled cocktails to places where a bartender wasn‚Äôt available. Their quest for premiumization led to a significant partnership with Beam Suntory in 2018, incorporating top-shelf spirits into their cocktails. This collaboration was a game-changer, propelling OTR into national recognition by 2019 and setting a new standard for the RTD market. A Success Story: Acquisition by Beam Suntory The pinnacle of OTR‚Äôs success story came in 2020 when Beam Suntory, a global leader in premium spirits, acquired OTR. This acquisition was not just a business transaction; it was an acknowledgment of OTR‚Äôs pioneering role in the premium pre-mixed cocktails category. With Beam Suntory‚Äôs backing, OTR was perfectly positioned to expand and innovate further in the rapidly growing spirits-based RTD market, which is one of the fastest-growing segments in the US. The Parallel Path of BoozyCardz BoozyCardz , with its innovative approach to greeting cards, mirrors the inventive spirit of OTR. Like OTR‚Äôs reinvention of the cocktail experience, BoozyCardz revolutionizes the traditional greeting card by integrating the joy of gifting a shot bottle. This blend of creativity and practicality places BoozyCardz on a similar trajectory to OTR ‚Äì starting from a unique idea, focusing on quality, and aiming for expansive growth. Inspiring Innovation in the Spirits Industry The story of OTR is not just about cocktails; it‚Äôs about vision, quality, and innovation. It demonstrates that with the right blend of creativity and strategic partnerships, startups can rise to become industry leaders. BoozyCardz , following in the footsteps of such trailblazers, is poised to make its mark in the gifting and spirits industry. It‚Äôs a testament to the fact that great ideas, when executed with passion and precision, can lead to extraordinary success. Back to News Boozy Cardz We're a US-based company that designs boozy greeting cards. Our innovative, patented design allows you to gift your favorite bottle to friends and family with a personal touch. Boozy Cardz can also be found at several liquor stores around the USA. P.S. Shot bottle is not included with purchase! Restaurant & Beach Club Miami Beach | Nikki Beach Skip to main content Menu Book now Select an option Restaurant Beach Club Close Book now (opens in new tab) Reservations Close Happenings Meetings & Events Menus Gallery Shop Global Home Careers Press Contact Nikki Beach Hospitality Group Destinations Europe Europe France Saint-Tropez Restaurant & Beach Club Greece Porto Heli Resort & Spa Restaurant Santorini Resort & Spa Restaurant & Beach Club Italy Costa Smeralda Restaurant & Beach Club Porto Cervo The Nikki Beach Cocktail Club Monaco Monte Carlo Restaurant & Beach Club Spain Marbella Restaurant & Beach Club Mallorca Restaurant & Beach Club Ibiza Restaurant & Beach Club Americas Americas Caribbean Saint Barth Restaurant & Beach Club Antigua IN DEVELOPMENT Resort & Spa Restaurant & Beach Club USA Miami Beach Restaurant & Beach Club Middle East Middle East UAE Dubai Resort & Spa Restaurant & Beach Club Ras Al-Khaimah IN DEVELOPMENT Resort & Spa Oman Muscat IN DEVELOPMENT Resort & Spa Restaurant & Beach Club Asia & Pacific Asia & Pacific Thailand Koh Samui Resort & Spa Restaurant & Beach Club Azerbaijan Baku Resort & Spa In Development Restaurant & Beach Club Miami Beach - Restaurant & Beach Club ‚Ä¢ USA Book now Nikki Beach Miami Beach: An Iconic Coastal Paradise on South Beach Welcome to Nikki Beach Miami Beach, an iconic South Beach destination since 1998. Located at 1 Ocean Drive in the exclusive South of Fifth neighborhood, Nikki Beach has evolved from a quaint seaside garden into the original barefoot luxury beach club, known for its vibrant atmosphere and exceptional service. Nikki Beach seamlessly blends music, dining, entertainment, fashion, film, and art into one unforgettable experience that defines the essence of Miami Beach. Indulge in full-service beachfront dining on lounge chairs or enjoy a meal with your toes in the sand at the restaurant. Whether basking in the sun or dining with friends, the atmosphere is completed by the sounds of the ocean and the unmistakable energy of Nikki Beach. The beach club also features a bar, a stylish lifestyle boutique, and private event spaces that cater to all types of memorable occasions. For those seeking a cool escape, the indoor dining area, Summer House, offers a welcoming retreat during Miami‚Äôs warmest days. With over 25 years of history, Nikki Beach Miami Beach continues to embody the quintessential Miami lifestyle, blending laid-back luxury with the vibrant spirit of South Beach in one of the world‚Äôs most famous beachside settings. Book now (opens in new tab) Dine & Drink At Nikki Beach Miami Beach, dining is a celebration of global flavors, curated by Executive Chef Frank Ferreiro. Chef Frank brings his culinary expertise and passion for fresh, high-quality ingredients to every dish, offering an eclectic menu that reflects the vibrant energy of South Beach. Enjoy signature favorites like Nikki Beach‚Äôs famous Sushi Boat, alongside fresh seafood, healthy salads, and dishes inspired by Nikki Beach locations around the world. Whether dining on the beachfront or in the open-air restaurant, each meal is a fusion of bold flavors and innovative presentations designed to elevate the Miami dining experience. Our menus Meetings & Events Nikki Beach Miami Beach is an exclusive beachfront venue offering a stunning backdrop for private events. With its blend of indoor and outdoor spaces, it's ideal for both intimate gatherings and large-scale celebrations, all tailored to create unforgettable experiences. On The Rocks Mobile Bar Welcome to Welcome to Welcome to Welcome to More Welcome to Welcome to Welcome to Welcome to On The Rocks is a mobile bar company that will bring a unique experience to any event! ABOUT US! On The Rocks Mobile Bar is perfect for any occasion! Our fully insured and RAMP certified bartending company will bring a unique experience to any event, whether it be a birthday celebration, graduation, bridal/baby shower, wedding or a simple get-together with friends and family. ¬†Due to state laws & regulations, we are a dry hire business, which means you provide the alcohol and we provide everything else! The team at On The Rocks will be sure never to leave any guest unhappy or a glass empty! HOW IT WORKS Inquire below about your event date. Please include your name, event type, date and preferred package. Once we have the basic information a contract will be drafted for you to accept. You will need to sign the contract and send a 50% deposit to secure your event date. We will then provide a custom shopping list specifically designed for your event allowing you to purchase alcohol to your preference. The remaining 50% balance will be due 30 days prior to the date of your event. *If you cancel our services >90 days in advance, you will receive 50% of your initial deposit back. *If you cancel <90 days to your event date no refund will be issued. PACKAGES & PRICING BRONZE ($1200) Mobile bar rental 3 hours of service Ice Mixers Simple garnishes Plastic glassware, napkins, straws Decor SILVER ($1450) Includes everything from Bronze package 4 hours of service Signature cocktail w/ premium garnishes GOLD ($1700) Includes everything from previous two packages 5 hours of service Additional signature cocktail *ALL EVENTS WITH <75 GUESTS WILL AUTOMATICALLY COME WITH ONE BARTENDER. IF THE EVENT IS 76-150 GUESTS A SECOND BARTENDER WILL BE REQUIRED - A FLAT FEE OF $150 WILL BE ADDED FOR THE SECOND BARTENDER. ANY EVENT >150 GUESTS WILL REQUIRE A THIRD BARTENDER AT THE SAME RATE. *AN ADDITIONAL CHARGE FOR ANYTHING OVER A 50 MILE RADIUS OF 18443 WILL BE $1/MILE ROUND TRIP. CONTACT US! Questions or Booking Send us a message or ask a question using this form. If inquiring about reserving us for an event please include event type, date and which package you would like to purchase. We will do our best to get back to you soon! Get in Touch! Get in Touch! Join Our Team A dedicated group of individuals‚Äìour staff, board of trustees, interns, and volunteers‚Äìmake this museum a leading cultural institution and community pillar. As active stewards and educators of history and culture, of our historic site, and of our collections, we strive to inspire an ever-growing audience to experience the local, regional, and global stories of Maine. Leadership Team Featured Chelsea Lane, Director of Visitor Experience Read More ‚Üí Kurt Spiridakis, Director of Boatbuilding Read More ‚Üí Jason Morin, Director of Operations Read More ‚Üí Luke Gates-Milardo, Director of Exhibits & Learning Read More ‚Üí Chris Timm, Executive Director Read More ‚Üí Rebecca Roche, Chief Advancement Officer Read More ‚Üí Chris Jacobs, Director of Finance Read More ‚Üí Kelly Page, Curator of Collections Read More ‚Üí Current Opportunities Featured Exhibit Designer Visitor Service Assistants (Volunteer) Visitor Experience Associate Percy & Small Shipyard Guide (Volunteer) Donnell House Guide (Volunteer) Our Board of Trustees, comprised of a group of dedicated individuals, who collectively guide and advise museum policies. Fletcher Raymond E. Hender Leonard W. Langer Kenneth Moller John G. Morse Andrew Perry Carl D. Rapp Mandy Reynolds Thomas Sturgeon Thomas C. Whelan Nancy A. Wilkes Victoria M. Willock John Zittel Volunteer with Us A SENSE OF ACCOMPLISHMENT‚Ä¶ As a nonprofit organization, the museum depends on its volunteers who annually contribute over $500,000 worth of their time, skills, and talents. As a Maine Maritime Museum volunteer, you will be able to work with others who share your interests and experience the sense of camaraderie that has lured people to the museum for over 50 years. There is something for everyone: maritime history, historic homes, gardening, art, education, and much more! Throughout the year, volunteers are invited to join in receptions, dinners, and cruises that celebrate their contributions. Volunteers who donate at least 15 hours of their time are also eligible for a complimentary membership and other exclusive benefits. VOLUNTEER LOG IN Looking for something else? To schedule a school visit for children, email us at education@maritimeme.org . To schedule a group tour for adults, email us at reservations@maritimeme.org . For weddings and private events, email us at events@maritimeme.org . For press inquiries, or anything else, email us at info@maritimeme.org . Prospective vendors for our museum store, email our store buyer at buyer@maritimeme.org . To inquire about donating an item to the collection, please complete this form . Have a question for the Curatorial Team? Submit a research request . Subscribe to Our Newsletter Sign up with your email address to receive news and updates. Email Address Sign Up Thank you! About Us ‚Äî 64 On The Rocks Skip to Content Open Menu Close Menu Home Food Drinks Rock About Us 64 On The Pier FAQ's Gallery 0 0 Home Food Drinks Rock About Us 64 On The Pier FAQ's Gallery 0 0 Open Menu Close Menu Home Food Drinks Rock About Us 64 On The Pier FAQ's Gallery Our Story Rockin‚Äô since 2020. EAT. DRINK. ROCK. People always ask, where did the name 64 On The Rocks come from? The answer is neither overly creative nor complex. ‚ÄúOn The Rocks‚Äù is our way of highlighting our amazing bar and a nod to our selection of bourbons and whiskeys. In order to make the name unique to us, we added the number sixty-four- our address in the quaint village of Fredonia- 64 West Main Street. At 64 On The Rocks, we have created an atmosphere that combines that big city feel with the comfort of home. During the warmer months, The Rocks is bustling with family and friends enjoying food and drinks on one of our outdoor patios or around our gorgeous back firepit. During the colder months, our customers are either cozied up next to our fireplace or enjoying dinner and drinks at one of our high-top tables, comfortable booths or at our stylish bar. We have you covered year-round! Your experience at 64 On The Rocks can be summed up in three words: Eat. Drink. Rock. You will love our pub-style menu which includes large portions and a fun selection of appetizers, unique burgers and sandwiches, personal style pizza, fingers, and our mouthwatering chicken wings in all flavors! Our bar offers a wide selection of draft and bottled beer, mixed cocktails, and our specialty drinks such as the Dwayne Johnson, Rocky Road or Pebble Beach to name a few. Lastly, on weekends stay and enjoy live music on either our indoor stage or weather permitting, back patio.¬† If hanging with friends and playing corn hole or darts is your thing, we have that too! We look forward to serving you and hope you enjoy your time with us. Contact 64 West Main Street Fredonia, NY 716-672-6464 info@64ontherocks.com 64 on THe Rocks Hours Thursday, Friday & Saturday: 4:30-Close (Kitchen closes 9pm) 64 ON THE PIER HOURS Open Daily 11am-Close (Kitchen Closes 8pm) Seasonal
